thread.title: Cape hockey Red Out raises funds
thread.title_full: Cape hockey Red Out raises funds

author: newsroom@capegazette.com (Staff)
title: Cape hockey Red Out raises funds
text:
Cape hockey Red Out raises funds Oct 08, 2015 Source: Submitted In back are (l-r) Amanda Sponaugle, Chloe Scheffer, Taylor Smith, Christina Benson, Cassidy Best, Madison Buchwald, Madi Irwin, Leah Barry, Carly Dmiterchik, Shea Sugrue, Mary Grace Cannon, Lexi Gooch, Lizzie Frederick, Tess Bernhiemer and coach Kate Austin. In third row are Hannah Bieler, Anna Harrington, Darby Klopp, Vienna Iocona, Maci Long, Victoria Lockwood, Korinne LeMaire, Anna Stiener, Katie Klabe, Hannah, Derrickson, Emma Ludwicki, Jackie Cannon and Kaeli O’ Neill-Wiley. In second row are Erin Cannon, Nicole Aikens, Alia Marshall, Lori Ferguson, Kaylie Truitt, Lindsay Monigle, Annie Judge, Katie Boyer, Carly Truitt, Melanie McCloy, Katie Frederick and Jillian Seker. In front are Stephanie Karl, Marcella Sabbagh, Jody Boyer, Erin Coverdale, Riley Shields, Sydney Ostroski and Carey Karl. 
The Cape Henlopen field hockey team recently raised funds for the American Heart Association on behalf of former Cape Henlopen High School ninth-grade geography teacher Kevin LeMaire. 
On Sep. 17, the team hosted a Red Out during the game versus Caesar Rodney; the entire team solicited donations from fans and raised $570. 
LeMaire’s wife Kari and his daughter Korinne, who is currently a sophomore on the field hockey team, along with his goddaughter, sophomore Victoria Lockwood, were thrilled to donate the money to the American Heart Association on behalf of their beloved father, husband and teacher, Kevin.
